Richmond.Bolling Haxall House: Bolling Haxall House, also known as the Woman's Club, is a historic residential building located in Richmond, Virginia. It was built in 1858 and is a three-story Italian Villa style dwelling of sandstone-colored stucco, scored to imitate ashlar. It features a projecting central entrance on the front facade, a raised portico (with arched openings) supported by four fluted columns, and an elaborate double-bracketed, dentiled cornice.
